intro: Chiococca pubescens var. peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
